fields.body: We can learn more from each other when information is open. A free exchange of ideas is critical to creating an environment where people are allowed to learn and use existing information toward creating new ideas.
fields.title: We believe in an open exchange

fields.body: Rapid prototypes can lead to rapid failures, but that leads to better solutions found faster. When you're free to experiment, you can look at problems in new ways and look for answers in new places. You can learn by doing.
fields.title: We believe in rapid prototyping

fields.body: In a meritocracy, the best ideas win. In a meritocracy, everyone has access to the same information. Successful work determines which projects rise and gather effort from the community.
fields.title: We believe in meritocracy

fields.body: Communities are formed around a common purpose. They bring together diverse ideas and share work. Together, a global community can create beyond the capabilities of any one individual. It multiplies effort and shares the work. Together, we can do more.
fields.title: We believe in community

fields.body: When we are free to collaborate, we create. We can solve problems that no one person may be able to solve on their own.
fields.title: We believe in the power of participation

fields.string: ElevenBits is a one-person company, started by Jan Willems in 2000, with a strong focus on Kaizen (改善, Japanese for "change for the better"). This quality concept can loosely be translated as "continuous improvement".

ElevenBits strongly applies and recommends the agile process management. ElevenBits uses a set of interrelated practices and rules that optimize the development environment, reduce organizational overhead, and closely synchronize market requirements with iterative prototypes.

Using modern process control theory, ElevenBits tries to build the best possible software given the available resources, acceptable quality, and required release dates. Useful product functionality is delivered every thirty days as requirements, architecture, and design emerge, even when using unstable technologies.

fields.body: Django is a high-level Python Web framework that encourages rapid development and clean, pragmatic design.  Django makes it easier to build better web applications more quickly with less code.  It is a framework for perfectionists with deadlines.  That's why we like it!
fields.title: Python and Django

fields.short: Indian Rail is the biggest employer of the world!
fields.name: Indian rail
fields.long: Installed internet on three commercial trains between Delhi and Kolkata.

fields.short: Broadcom was set up in 1987 and was 45pc-owned by Eircom and 45pc-owned by Swedish mobile phone maker Ericsson, with 10pc held by Trinity College.  It closed down the beginning of 2002.
fields.name: Broadcom Eirann Reasearch
fields.long: In Broadcom we built a system which allowed Telco staff to change cellular stations data (like its ranges, bandwidth, parents, siblings,...).  We wrote it in Java and and build it on our own Corba based framework.  JNI was used to communicate with the cellular networks.

fields.short: At the Lisbon summit in March 2000 EU governments called for a better use of European research efforts through the creation of an internal market for science and technology 'European Research Area'.   FP6 is the financial instrument to help make ERA a reality.
fields.name: European Union
fields.long: Worked as deployment officer of the FP6 framework.  Was built on top of WebLogic Servers and an Oracle Real Application Cluster.  Work close to the architect of the solution.

fields.short: BASE is a telephony services and broadband internet brand operated by KPN Group in Belgium and Germany.
fields.name: Base
fields.long: In Belgium there are two other big telco's: Proximus and Mobistar. We worked on the implementation of Mobile Number Portability between these three operators. A Java Message Queue was used together with some JAXB.

fields.short: Accenture plc is a multinational management consulting, technology services and outsourcing company headquartered in Dublin, Republic of Ireland.
fields.name: Accenture
fields.long: We developed with Accenture the belgium.be website. It is built around a WebLogic, Documentum and some Java XML libraries.

fields.short: Vodafone Ireland Limited, part of the Vodafone Group, is the largest mobile phone company in Ireland in terms of active subscribers, and was previously called Eircell.
fields.name: Eircell
fields.long: We reported to Eircell board on new technologies and techniques.

fields.short: Eircom Group Ltd. (aka "Eircom") is a fixed, mobile and broadband telecommunications company in Ireland.
fields.name: Eircom
fields.long: We reported to Eircom board on new technologies and techniques.

fields.short: Cape Technologies started as a small provider of services to Ericsson Ireland, but after building a fraud management system for telco's WeDo Technologies bought them.
fields.name: Cape Technologies
fields.long: At Cape Technologies we build several Java based projects for several customers.  For example a system for SMS handling (was very hot those days), and a security system on top of the j2ee system (JAAS like), and the first mobile pages, combined with regular websites.

fields.short: Ericsson is a Swedish multinational technology company that provides and operates telecommunications networks, television and video systems, and related services.
fields.name: Ericsson Ireland
fields.long: We worked together with Broadcom and Cape Technologies at a product which allowed telco's to manage their cellular links.  The application could learn how it could alter the system to allow a better service to its customers.

fields.short: 21Net is a global provider of on-board broadband Internet, multimedia and connectivity solutions for railway companies.
fields.name: 21Net
fields.long: Designed and deployed a complete solution which enabled all passengers and strain staff to access the internet, view videos on demand, watch videos in the cinema coach, book tickets,...

fields.name: Klink
fields.text:
A wedding application which allows the couple to invite people to the church, the dinner party, or any other part of the big event. The website allows people to log in, to rsvp, to buy wedding gifts,...

It is built in PHP without any framework.  It is used well, but needs some work.  Or a conversion to Django, or the Symfony framework should be used.
